meanings.definition: Cause severe and extensive damage or destruction to.
meanings.sent1: The storm ravages the small town, leaving behind a path of destruction.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire ravages the forest, destroying everything in its path.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel ravages the bird feeder, scattering seeds everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Time ravages our memories, fading them like old photographs.
meanings.sent5: The disease ravages the body, weakening it day by day.

meanings.sent1: The ravages of war are evident in the broken buildings and displaced families.
meanings.sent2: The ravages of time can be seen in the worn-out pages of the ancient book.
meanings.sent3: The ravages of a sweet tooth are evident in the empty cookie jar.
meanings.sent4: The ravages of neglect are visible in the overgrown garden.
meanings.sent5: The ravages of pollution are seen in the murky waters of the river.
